artefact.overview: Consumer protection scheme for flights and what type of licence you need - standard, small business, ATOL to ATOL, franchised ATOL
artefact.licence_short_description: How to apply for an Air Travel Organiser's Licence and what type of licence you need.
artefact.licence_overview:
There are 4 types of ATOL licence:

* standard ATOL – if you plan to carry more than 500 passengers each year
* small business ATOL – if you plan to sell less than 500 flights or holidays each year
* ATOL to ATOL trade sales – if you sell flights or holiday packages to other ATOL holders
* franchised ATOL – if you are a member of an approved travel trade organisation and sell less than 1,000 flights or holidays each year

You don't need your own ATOL if you are selling flights as an agent for an ATOL holder. However, you must record and keep documentation of your sales.

##How to apply 

Download the application form for the licence you need:

$D Download ['Standard ATOL application' (PDF, 700KB](http://www.caa.co.uk/docs/33/20120124StandardNewApp.pdf "Standard ATOL application"){:rel="external"} $D

$D Download ['Small business ATOL application' (PDF, 500KB)](http://www.caa.co.uk/docs/33/20120117SBANewApp.pdf " Small business ATOL application"){:rel="external"} $D

$D Download ['ATOL to ATOL Trade application' (PDF, 700KB)](http://www.caa.co.uk/docs/33/20120124StandardNewApp.pdf "ATOL to ATOL trade application"){:rel="external"} $D


To apply for a franchised ATOL apply direct to the [approved organisation you belong to.](http://www.caa.co.uk/default.aspx?catid=582&pagetype=90&pageid=9499 "CAA listed franchised ATOL approved organisations"){:rel="external"}

You can find [information and documentation to apply for a new ATOL](http://www.caa.co.uk/default.aspx?catid=582&pagetype=90 "information and documentation to apply for a new ATOL"){:rel="external"} on the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) website or contact the heldesk for new applicants for help with your application.

$C
**ATOL licence helpdesk - new applicants**

<newapplicants@caa.co.uk>  
**Telephone:** 020 7453 6361  
**Fax:** 020 7453 6494
$C
 
## ATOL Certificate for your customers
From 1 October 2012 you must supply all customers who pay towards any flight or holiday that is ATOL protected, with an ATOL Certificate. The certificate must state how a trip involving air travel is protected and by whom.

Find details about [the certificate on the CAA website.](http://www.caa.co.uk/application.aspx?catid=33&pagetype=65&appid=11&mode=detail&id=5068 "Guidance on completion and supply of ATOL certificate"){:rel="external"}






*[ATOL]: Air Travel Organiser's Licence
*[CAA]: Civil Aviation Authority
*[ATT]: Air Travel Trust
